title: IIT Bombay: Admission 2024, Cutoff, Courses, Fees, Placement, Ranking
meta_description: IIT Bombay Admission 2024 is open for B.Tech, M.Tech and other courses. IIT Bombay is ranked #3 by the NIRF in the Engineering category. IIT Bombay college offers B.Tech, Integrated B.Tech, M.Tech and Ph.D courses. BTech Cutoff for admission is 3-4000 in the JEE Advanced exam.
keywords: IIT Bombay (IITB), IIT Bombay notable alumni, IIT Bombay BTech, IIT Bombay MTech, IIT Bombay PhD, IIT Bombay ranking, IIT Bombay cutoff, IIT Bombay Fees

basic_info.name: IIT Bombay Scholarships 2024
description: IIT Bombay offers numerous scholarships and if you are the one that qualifies for the criteria you can avail of many scholarships such as Postgraduate Assistantships, MS Scholarships, Teaching Assistantships for Dual Degree Programs, and Undergraduate Scholarships. In the UG Scholarships section, the major IIT Bombay Scholarships are Institute cum Merit Scholarships, Remission of Fees, Names Scholarships/ Private Scholarships, National Scholarships, and National Talent Search Scholarships.
Some of the most popular scholarship schemes offered by IIT Bombay and other Private Scholarships are as follows.

basic_info.name: IIT Bombay Campus
description: IIT Bombay campus is spread over 545 Acres of land in Powai nestled amongst hills and flanked by the Powai and Vihar lakes. Further, it is the first public college to have laid the foundation stone with assistance from UNESCO and has been declared as an Insititute of National Importance by the Parliament of India.
Highlights on major facilities offered at IIT Bombay are given below:

Library: IIT Bombay Central Library is a four-storied building with a carpet area of over 63,000 sft. and is located towards the North of the Main building. It has a total collection of 4.40 lakh items that comprises 2,53,504 Books, Theses, CDs & Videos, 21,403 E-Books, 12,203 TLL & BC (Book Bank) Collection, 1,19,576 Bound Volumes of Journals, 67,931 Reports, Pamphlets & Standards, 4,417 Photocopies, 37,00,000+ Journals (Print, Online) & 36,247 IITB Repositories. The library remains open from 9 AM to 11 PM on weekdays and 10 AM to 5 PM on weekends and holidays. The library has 12 servers, 45 PCs and other accessories adequate to cater to the needs of users. 6 PCs are meant for users to access OPAC, databases, e-books, e-journals and other e-resources. The reading area in the library have been WI-Fi enabled to provide wireless access to the Internet.

Sports: The inistute caters to a wide range of sports activities like badminton, table tennis, chess, yoga, basketball, football, hockey, volleyball and more for students for internal and external participation. These sports facilities are organized and overseen by students, but they are also open to faculty and staff members.

Event Venues: IITB has variety of venues suitable for different purposes, including lectures, seminars, conferences, and personal events. Some of these venues include Victor Menezes Convention Center (VMCC), Lecture Halls, Auditoriums & venues for personal/official events.
IIT Bombay Hostels: IITB Campus comprises 17 hostels for students. Each hostel is an independent entity with its mess facilities, recreational areas, etc. The hostel fee at IIT Bombay is INR 17,250.
Day Care: The institute also has a day-care facility for children between 2 to 12 years of age.

Section.name: About IIT Bombay
Section.description:
Established in 1958, Indian Institute of Technology Bombay popularly known as IIT Bombay or IIT Mumbai is an autonomous institute and deemed university located in the Powai region of Bombay. IIT Bombay is the most preferred IIT because 75% of JEE Advanced top rankers opt for IIT Bombay for its excellent placement records. IIT Mumbai is recognized by UGC & AICTE. According to the NIRF Ranking 2023, IITB is ranked 3rd in the Engineering category. Internationally, IIT Bombay is ranked 149 by the QS World University Ranking 2024 under the Top Global Universities.
At the undergraduate level, Indian Institute of Technology Bombay offers B.Tech, B.Tech + M.Tech, B.Sc & B.Des whereas at the postgraduate level, it offers M.Tech, M.Tech + PhD, M.Des, MBA, MA + PhD, M.Sc + PhD etc. It also offers PhD in a variety of disciplines. In total, it offers 80+ courses via its 17 departments. IIT Bombay B.Tech is one of the most preferred course offered at the institute. Aspirants must appear for JEE Advanced and JoSAA counselling for admission to its B.Tech program. B.Tech tuition fee at IIT Bombay is INR 1,00,000 per semester for Indian nationals & INR 3,00,000 per semester for Foreign nationals. For admission to its PG courses, the institute accepts GATE, CEED, IIT JAM, CAT Scores. Further, it accepts MET (M.Phil. Entrance Test) for M.Phil. programme. The institute also offers innovative short-term courses, continuing education and distance learning.
IIT Bombay Placement 2024 concluded with an average annual package of INR 23.5 LPA. During the recent placements, IIT-Bombay sees the minimum salary drop to INR 4 Lakhs. A total of 75% of students secured jobs in this placement drive with 1,475 job offers being accepted. This marks a decline from last year's 82 percent placement rate. IIT Bombay is also a trendsetter among the top IITs with the highest package as high as INR 3.67 CPA (international) & INR 1.68 CPA (domestic) during IIT Bombay Placement 2023. The top recruiters at IIT Bombay include Airbus, Apple, Google, Intel, Uber, Rubrik and Millennium etc.

IIT Bombay includes the following departments of studies.
The popularly compared colleges with IIT Bombay are given below:
IIT Bombay Vs IIT Delhi: When we compare IIT Delhi and IIT Bombay, both the colleges are located at great locations. Both cities are close to the offices of top recruiters in the country. The placements at IIT Bombay and IIT Delhi are exceptional. The highest package offered in IIT Bombay is INR 3.67 CPA and the average package is INR 21.82 Lakhs. In IIT Delhi, the highest package of INR 2.68 was recorded in 2023 placements while the average package stood at INR 28 LPA.
IIT Bombay Vs IIT Madras: IIT Madras is India’s top-ranking engineering institution while IIT Bombay is ranked 3rd in NIRF 2023 rankings in the Engineering category. The highest package offered at IIT Bombay is INR 3.67 CPA, while in IIT Madras the highest package of INR 1.31 CPA is offered in 2023 placements.
IIT Bombay Vs IISc Bangalore: IISc Bangalore is known for its great research opportunities offered at the undergraduate level. The highest package offered at IISc Bangalore is 85 LPA. However, the highest package of INR 3.67 CPA was offered in IIT Bombay Placements 2023.IIT Bangalore offers BTech program in 10 specializations however, BTech Mathematics and Computing is the only Engineering option at IISc Bangalore.
IIT Bombay Vs IIT Kharagpur: IIT Kharagpur and IIT Bombay, both are placed among the top-ranking Engineering colleges in the country. IIT Kharagpur & IIT Bombay NIRF 2023 are ranked at 6th and 3rd respectively in the engineering category. The placements at both the IIT Bombay and IIT Kharagpur are exceptional with the highest package of INR 3.67 CPA and INR 2.67 CPA. The JEE Advanced cutoff for admission to the BTech CSE program at IIT Kharagpur stood at 261 while at IIT Bombay BTech CSE admissions were invited at 60.7.
Ques. Where is IIT Bombay located?
Ans. IIT Bombay is located in Powai, a northeastern suburb of Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. The exact address of IIT Bombay is:
Indian Institute of Technology Bombay (IIT Bombay), Powai, Mumbai - 400076, Maharashtra, India
The campus is situated near Powai Lake and is well-connected to the rest of Mumbai through various transportation modes. It is approximately 10 kilometers away from Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport.
Ques. What are the courses offered IIT Bombay?
Ans. IIT offers a variety of academic programs in three main sections to support an extensive range of learning objectives. The Undergraduate Programs, which include B.Tech., Dual Degree, B.S., and B.Des., offer students starting their higher education path a basic education. The Postgraduate Programs are as follows: M.Tech./M.Tech.+Ph.D. (Dual Degree), M.Des., M.Des. by Research, MBA, MBA (Executive), M.Sc.-Ph.D. (Dual Degree) in Energy, MPP, M.S. by Research (CSE/Data Science and Artificial Intelligence in CMinds.), Master of Arts by Research (MA.Res.), MA+Ph.D. (Dual Degree) in Philosophy, and Master in Development Practice (MDP). The Ph.D. option is another one for research programs that encourage advanced research and academic endeavors.
Ques. For what IIT Bombay is famous for?
Ans. Electrical engineering and computer science are IIT Bombay's strongest departments. IIT Bombay offers excellent research opportunities as well. IIT Bombay provides students with plenty of opportunities to pursue research in their areas of interest thanks to its cutting-edge research facilities and substantial industrial linkages. The reputation of IIT Bombay as one of the best engineering schools, along with its top-notch staff, state-of-the-art research facilities, varied student body, strong industry linkages, and plenty of job prospects, make it an extremely preferred college.
Ques. How are the placements at IIT Bombay?
Ans. The final report for the 2023 IIT Bombay Placements is out. Compared to the previous year, there was a 5.2% rise in the number of placed students. The highest package offered by IIT Bombay was INR 3.67 CPA, while the average package climbed by 1.5% to INR 21.82 LPA. 1898 job offers were made to students; 1516 of those offers were accepted. Additionally, 963 summer and 141 winter internships were reported by IIT Bombay. In all, 384 recruiters took part in the 2023 IIT Bombay Placements. Among the leading employers were Boston Consulting Group, McKinsey & Company, Honda Japan, American Express, and others.
Ques. What is the minimum percentage to get admission to IIT Bombay M.Tech?
Ans. A bachelor's degree in any field (10+2+3/4) with 60% marks (or a first class as determined by the university) for GN/EWS/OBC(NC) and 55% for SC/ST/PwD categories is required of the candidate. IIT Bombay MTech admission depends on the GATE scores of the candidates. Along with that, candidates must have completed their graduation in Engineering or Technology or any other relevant field with 60% minimum marks. All GATE-qualified candidates must register for the COAP counselling to reserve a seat at the institute.
Ques. How much is the B.Tech fee at IIT Bombay?
Ans. A detailed IIT Bombay’s B.Tech Fee Structure 2024 is tabulated below:
Ques. Which entrance exams are accepted at IIT Bombay?
Ans. JEE-Main followed by JEE-Advance GATE, CEED, MET, IIT JAM, CAT Scores are accepted at IIT Bombay for admission to various courses.
Ques. How can i take admission to IIT Bombay PhD?
Ans. IIT Bombay PhD program admission is based on the GATE/CEED/ UGC-NET score. The program is offered in 36 specializations and the annual fee for the program is INR 39,700. Admission for the IIT Bombay PhD program is conducted twice a year. Candiadtes with the following eligibility can apply for IIT Bombay PhD Admission.
Ques. How to check IIT Bombay Results
Ans. IIT Bombay has a semester system with summer and winter semesters. The results of each semester are released shortly after the exams for that semester begin. You can check the results of IIT Bombay by going to the Deemed University's official website. By entering their required information, including their registration number and program, candidates can view the result.
